lexUnit.name: proximity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being within a short distance (of).

sentence.text: In my new proximity to him I was able to see that his hands were neither wrinkled , nor dotted with liverish spots .
Doak now has over 30 written accounts of dolphins living in close proximity to humans .
In later years , the site became quite complex , with a number of mills operating in close proximity to one another .
The latter flows down towards Standish itself , where it formerly provided the power for two corn mills in fairly close proximity to one another .
As one of London 's most influential club DJs , Peterson is in constant and close proximity to the streets and the clubs .
ABOVE : Port Mill , showing its proximity to the canal basin .
The Sussex coast was best seen at a distance , though , for proximity to the sea causes human beings to create great ugliness .
Not showing this year are Agnew 's and the Redfern , both of whose galleries are in extremely close proximity to the Royal Academy .
Proximity to the Atlantic means rainfall in Britain contains quite a lot of dissolved salts from the sea .
From the very start the surface temperature on Venus must have been much hotter than that on Earth -- purely because of the planets proximity to the Sun .
Cuba 's proximity to the United States has given it great value for Soviet intelligence , surveillance and communications operations .
Many of the villages in close proximity to Sherwood Forest have also played a role in the legendary tales of our hero .
Rainbow confesses to a need to talk of private , painful things , outside the intrusive proximity of small children and sisters-in-law .
The Proximity of the factory and its computers seemed to charge the Worm .
He was painfully aware of the proximity of her body as she leant over the desk .
The proximity of the Bahamas to the States means that the American influence is very much in evidence , reflected particularly in the high standards of service , comfort and cuisine .
More commonly , however , it was ill health in conjunction with other factors , such as proximity to retirement age , which determined propensity to retire early .
Bob felt like twitting him because he had n't signed the stairs key out , but because of the proximity of sudden death decided that to do so would be unfeeling and flippant .
Ace 's proximity was playing hell with her hormones .
Inevitably it meant that she and Jack were in closer proximity , and it threatened to push her sanity over the brink .

To increase energy conservation and reduce pollution , the report , Energy Conscious Planning , calls for mixed developments with housing , shops , services and workplaces in close proximity to each other , linked by high-quality public transport services , cycleways and footpaths .
